syllabi_diff.math_scope: Primes and prime factorisation; HCF and LCM; squares, cubes, roots via factorisation; integer, rational and real number arithmetic; ordering and representation on number line; inequality symbols; rounding, estimation, standard form A×10^n; positive/negative/zero/fractional indices and laws of indices; calculator use and numerical representation.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: No substantive change to technical content or required operations; any differences are editorial/formatting only.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Ratios of rational numbers; reduction to simplest form; map scales (distance and area); direct and inverse proportion relationships and computations.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Scope and procedures (direct/inverse proportion and scale work) remain the same.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Expressing quantities as percentages, comparisons, percentages >100%, percentage increase/decrease, reverse percentages and related computations.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: No change to percentage topics, problem types or technical expectations.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Average rate and speed calculations; unit conversion (e.g. km/h ↔ m/s); interpretation of distance–time and speed–time contexts (as used in real-world problems).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Technical coverage and unit-conversion requirements unchanged.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Literal notation; evaluation of expressions; translation of contexts into algebra; nth-term expressions; linear expression manipulation, expansion, factorisation (including common factors); factorisation of quadratics ax^2+bx+c; algebraic fractions (multiplication/division, addition/subtraction with linear/quadratic denominators); changing the subject of formulae; binomial identities (a±b)^2 and a^2−b^2.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: All algebraic manipulations, identities and fraction operations remain; no additions/removals of formulae or techniques.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Cartesian plane; graphs of ordered pairs; linear (y=ax+b) and quadratic (y=ax^2+bx+c) functions; gradients of lines; properties and sketching of quadratics including vertex form and factorised form; graphs of power functions y=ax^n for specified n (−2, −1, 0, 1, 2, 3) and simple sums; exponential graphs y=k a^x (a positive integer); estimation of curve gradient via tangent.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Graph types and sketching/interpretation skills unchanged; no new function families or removed graph techniques.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Solving linear equations and simple fractional equations reducible to linear; simultaneous linear equations in two variables (substitution, elimination, graphical); solving quadratic equations (factorisation, quadratic formula, completing the square, graphically); fractional equations reducible to quadratics; formulating equations from contexts; solving linear inequalities and representing solutions on number line.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Algebraic solution methods and problem formulation expectations remain the same.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Set notation and language: ∪, ∩, n(A), ∈, ∉, complement A′, empty and universal sets, subset/proper subset relations, Venn diagrams, union/intersection operations and interpretations.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Set concepts and notation are retained; any symbol/typography differences do not alter mathematical content.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Representation of data in matrices; interpretation of matrix data; scalar multiplication; addition and (where defined) product of matrices for problem solving.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: No change to matrix operations or expected problem types.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Angle types (acute, obtuse, right, reflex); angle relationships (vertically opposite, straight line, at a point); angles formed by parallel lines and transversals (corresponding, alternate, interior); properties of triangles, special quadrilaterals and regular polygons (including symmetry); angle-sum rules for convex polygons; basic geometric constructions with ruler/compass/protractor/ set squares.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Geometric properties and construction skills remain the same in technical scope.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Definition and identification of congruent and similar figures; properties of similar triangles and polygons (equal corresponding angles, proportional corresponding sides); enlargement/reduction, scale drawings; perpendicular/angle bisector constructions; criteria for triangle congruence/similarity; area and volume ratios of similar figures; solving related problems.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Similarity/congruence content and proportional reasoning unchanged.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Circle symmetry properties (equal chords equidistant from centre, perpendicular bisector of chord through centre, tangent equal lengths from external point, angle bisected by line from centre between tangents); circle angle theorems (angle in a semicircle, tangent–radius right angle, angle at centre twice angle at circumference, equal angles in same segment, supplementary opposite segment angles).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Circle theorems and related geometric facts retained without substantive change.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Use of Pythagoras’ theorem (including converse); sine/cosine/tangent ratios for acute angles to find sides/angles in right triangles; extension of sine and cosine to obtuse angles; area of triangle using (1/2)ab sin C; sine and cosine rules for any triangle; 2D and 3D problems including bearings, elevation/depression.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Trigonometric ratios, laws and applications remain the same; no added or removed rules.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Area of parallelogram and trapezium; perimeter and area of composite plane figures; volumes and surface areas of cube, cuboid, prism, cylinder, pyramid, cone, sphere; conversion between units (cm^2↔m^2, cm^3↔m^3); composite solid problems; arc length and sector/segment area; radian measure and degree–radian conversion.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Mensuration formulas and unit-conversion requirements continue unchanged.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Gradient of line from two coordinates; distance between two points; equation of straight line in form y=mx+c; coordinate methods for geometric problems (e.g., locus, midpoints implicit in tasks).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Coordinate geometry skills and formulae unchanged.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Vector notation/representation as directed segments and column vectors; translations; position vectors; magnitude (√(x^2+y^2)); vector addition/subtraction and scalar multiplication; expressing vectors in terms of two coplanar vectors; geometric problem solving with vectors.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Vector concepts and operations unchanged (only minor notational formatting differences between documents).

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Data collection/classification/tabulation; interpretation of tables, bar/pictogram/line/pie/dot/histogram/stem-and-leaf/cumulative frequency/box-and-whisker; pros/cons and misuse of representations; measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode); mean for grouped data; quartiles/percentiles; measures of spread (range, IQR, standard deviation) with calculation for grouped and ungrouped data; comparing datasets using mean and SD.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Statistical summaries, representations and measures of spread remain the same in technical content.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Probability basics as measure of chance; probability of single events; listing outcomes; simple combined events; use of possibility and tree diagrams; addition rule for mutually exclusive events; multiplication rule for independent events.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Probability topics and combinational devices (trees, possibility diagrams) unchanged.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Provided formulae such as compound interest, mensuration formulae (areas, volumes, surface areas, arc length, sector area), triangle area (1/2 ab sin C), trigonometric identities and cosine rule, and statistical formulae (mean and standard deviation expressions).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: The set of formulae provided to candidates remains the same; no new formulas added or removed.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Comprehensive reference of notation covering set theory, symbols, operations, functions, calculus notation (limits, derivatives, integrals), exponential/logarithmic functions, circular functions, complex numbers, matrices, vectors, and probability/statistics notation (distributions, expectations, variance, correlation).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Notation list and scope are effectively the same; only minor typographical or publisher-attribution differences across versions.
